item.title: 8 Ways Smart People Use Failure To Their Advantage
item.description:
8 Ways Smart People Use Failure To Their Advantage

Failure is an inevitable part of life, but smart people know how to make it work for them. Learn how to use failure to propel you forward.

item.title: Steve Jobs: don't start a business unless there's 'a wrong that you want to right'
item.description:
Steve Jobs: don't start a business unless there's 'a wrong that you want to right'

As the funding climate in Silicon Valley cools, a lot of old-timers are looking on the bright side: at least this will wash out the startup founders who were only ever in it for the money - the "tourists" as Alfred Lin from Sequoia calls them.

item.title: Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry
item.description:
Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry

If there's an example of a company about to disruptively innovate an entire industry, it's Tesla. Partly, this is because of raw technology--Tesla's is clearly superior to that of its competitors. Partly, it's because Tesla has a more efficient business model. As Slate recently pointed out, Tesla bypasses value-subtracting dealer franchises and universally disliked car salespeople.
